results.title: Delegates
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart and Derek Hart Productions
results.brief_description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. The role of the delegates is clearly portrayed as they visit families to discover their needs and distribute aid, act as mediators in tricky and often dangerous situations and to generally bring about peace and reduce human suffering
results.description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. results.title: Delayed parenthood: pros and cons
results.brief_description: Looks at the increasing number of women who are having children later in life because of career pressure. Risks such as birth defects are examined and women who have had children later in life are interviewed.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 6-10
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 6-10 include: Thou shalt not commit adultery (58 min.)— Thou shalt not steal (55 min.)—Thou shalt not bear false witness (54 min.)— Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife (58 min.)—Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s goods (57 min.). Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Dekalog = The Ten commandments. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: ‘The Ten Commandments’ according to Kieslowski are ten 55 minute dramas made as a television series (although two were also released in longer form as theatrical features), set in and around a Warsaw housing estate. Together they constitute something like an analysis of the shortcomings of contemporary Polish society, although the individual dilemmas are quite universal. The moral imperatives of the Commandments are tempered by an underlying sympathy for the characters. Parts 1-5 include: I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other God but me (53 min.)—Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain (57 min.)—Honour the Sabbath Day (55 min.)— Honour thy father and mother (55 min.)—Thou shalt not kill (57 min.) Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

Scripted by Krzysztof Kieslowski and Krzysztof Piesiewicz.

results.title: Deirdre Jack: Swifts Creek Artist
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Local painter, Deirdre Jack, is passionate about her local environment. The rolling hills and golden fields that surround her Swifts Creek bush studio inevitably make their way into her vibrant oil paintings and pastel sketches. Fruit, however, is the main subject of her exhibition at the Great Alpine Gallery, a small exhibition space that sits in the heart of Swifts Creek and run voluntarily by a group of fellow artists. The gallery has been a vital place for local artists since 1989 despite the challenges of running an art space in a small rural town.

results.title: Degenocide: the second best of the original DGeneration
results.creator_credit: Joe Murray, Peter Ots, David Cameron, Ted Emery, Kris Noble, Mark Gibson, Michael Hirsch, Andrew Knight and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This video contains comedy sketches from the 1986 and 1987 ABC seasons of the D-Generation, the best of the 1988 Channel 7 specials inculding ‘Degenocide’, and the re-voicing of ‘Homicide’. Starring such comedy luminaries as Rob Sitch, Magda Szubanski, Santo Cilauro, Marg Downey and Michael Veitch and including such classics as: ‘Thunderbirds’, ‘The Kerrigan Brothers’, ‘The Irish Rovers’ and ‘Tommy Cravat Jnr’, ‘The Dubbo Olympics’ and a very poor snooker trick indeed!

results.title: Degenerate art: the avant-garde in Nazi Germany
results.creator_credit: David Grubin and LA County Museum of Art
results.brief_description: A thorough documentary on Hitler’s Germany from the point of view of the German art world that explores the impact of war and the Nazi regime on artists and the nature of art in Germany. The program is centred around a study of the artists and the works condemned in Hitler’s “Degenerate Art” exhibition following his rise to power after the Great Depression. This badly presented, propaganda style exhibition took 650 abstract and expressionist works from museums and private collections around Germany and toured Germany and Austria for four years as an example of the abstraction and inner awareness that was unacceptable to Hitler’s vision for the new conformist Germany. It was held up as a contrast to Hitler’s self curated exhibits of his vision for new German art at the House of German art opened in 1937. The documentary contains interviews with artists’ families, art critics, historians, and art students, curators and journalists of the time and a detailed analysis of the lives of the condemned artists and innovative art movements such as the Expressionist and Bauhaus school that they represented. These elements, combined with a broad based study of Hitler’s rise to power, and the social, cultural and political impact of the Nazi leadership on Germany, provides a striking perspective on the mass persuasion techniques, suppression, targeting of, and aggression towards, alternative views or unrecognised groups during Hitler’s dictatorship. It also considers the consequences of this history for the future of German art.

results.title: Degas in the Metropolitan
results.creator_credit: Jehane Burns, Ray Eames, Charles Eames and Metropolitan Museum of Art
results.brief_description: This brilliant comprehensive study of French artist Edgar Degas takes us on a leisurely tour through the New York Metropolitan Museum of Art’s extraordinary collection of his works. An extended presentation of paintings, drawings, prints and sculptures gives a clearly structured view of Degas’ life and career. The music of Satie and Chopin are performed by Zita Carno under the direction of Elmer Bernstein, narrated by Charles S. Moffat.

results.title: Degas
results.creator_credit: Skira-Flag Films and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Degas was unique in his ability to synthesize the skill of the classic draftsman with the innovative techniques of the impressionist. His chief interest was the female figure and he never tired of painting the curve of an arm or the extension of a leg. What mattered to him was the light and shade on the human figure. Art students can learn much from his drawings, space arrangements and brilliant coloring.
